content.protection: 10 bolts to rap anchor= Glue-ins and Muss hooks.Added a new 1st bolt on 9-18-21Hope you enjoy :)

content.description: Great for the grade, for the area. Climb the vertical face on the left side of the tower to a high crux. Using the left wall is possible and easier. Stays mostly in the shade when other walls are sweltering.
content.location: On the left side of the Sun Tower, climbing just to the right of a chossy corner.

content.description:
Climbs the main face of the tower.  Crux is the lower section to the first ledge. 

  There is a two bolt anchor at the first ledge but the climb continues to the top. 

  The alternate exit is to the left at the roof but no fixed anchor.
content.location: The main face of the Sun Tower

content.description: Fun route around the corner from Sunshine Daydream. Good holds all the way, with a crux near the top because of a protruding boulder. You can go right or left there; the last bolt is above it.
content.protection: four bolts to a fixed anchor
content.location: You can scramble up on either side of the Sun Tower, but the right side seems easier. Either way, hike gingerly to avoid a fall and to minimize erosion. Watch out for big, loose boulders in the draws. The start is to the left of the huge bolted roof, just around the corner from the top half of Sunshine Daydream. Look for a twisted, spindly pine on top; the anchors are just below that.

content.description: Climbs the arete to the right of REM.
content.location: On the Sun Tower.  Start on the same ledge as REM on the West facing side of the tower.

content.description: This route is... well... okay. Slightly steep jugs give way to easier, ledgy climbing and a big shelf with the anchors. This route is kinda dirty and unremarkable, save for the cool homemade bolt hanger near the top (don't clip, just look!)
content.location: Walk past the Sun Tower and past a large roof with two bolted lines, looking for a huge fallen pine tree. The Bastard Son is the lone route on a face just to the right of the tree.

content.description: Past the Oven toward the right side of the Pit is the Son Tower, a semi-detached formation with a good concentration of moderate routes. All of the climbs here are 5.10 or under. The rock is fairly solid, but broken up by many ledges. Shaded on hot days.
